item.title: PhD Position Call
item.description:
PhD Programme in Biosciences

Curriculum: Genetics, Genomics and Bioinformatics

Crosstalk of Cancer Genome and Tumor Microenvironment in Ovarian Cancer Metastases at Single-Cell Resolution

Contact: Prof. Chiara Romualdi â€“ chiara.romualdi@unipd.it

Ovarian cancer is the leading cause of death from gynecological malignancies and is frequently diagnosed at an advanced metastatic stage. Metastases form a complex ecosystem of diverse, interacting cells, whose genomic and transcriptomic heterogeneity shapes the tumor microenvironment (TME) and drives tumor aggressiveness. Despite extensive research, the mechanisms underlying tumorâ€“TME crosstalk remain poorly understood. This PhD project aims to investigate the dynamic interplay between cancer genomes and TME composition in primary tumors and matched metastases across different histological subtypes. The selected candidate will use computational approaches to analyze genomic and transcriptomic data at single-cell resolution, comparing primary and metastatic tumor sites.

item.title: Our new paper on isomiRs expression in Stage I Ovarian Cancer is out !
item.description: Our work represents the first attempt to characterize isomiRs expression in Stage I EOC within and across subtypes and to contextualize their alterations in the framework of the large genomic heterogeneity of this tumor. https://doi.org/10.1002/ijc.34408

item.title: Our new paper on CNV patterns in Stage I Ovarian Cancer is out !
item.description:
In this work we show that novel molecular markers, in this case genomic instability patterns, can anticipate the behavior of stage I EOC regardless of tumor subtype and provide valuable prognostic information.
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ejca.2022.05.005
